Instrument.name: The Dust Impact Mass Analyzer (PUMA) for Vega 1
Instrument.description: The Dust Impact Mass Analyzer (PUMA) on Vega 1 and Vega 2 were similar time-of-flight spectrometers in construction, but had different targets. PUMA-1, aboard Vega 1, had a corrugated silver film impact target such that a large amount of projectile ions entered the analyzer vs. the flat silver film target of Vega 2. Both PUMA-1 and PUMA-2 had a dust mass range of 3x10^-16 to 5x10^-10g, and an atomic mass range of 1 to 110 atomic mass units (amu). The PUMA spectrometers measured the size and spatial density of solid particles, with a particular emphasis on the determination of the Li, C, abd B isotopic ratios.
